reviewText: IF YOU FIND THIS HELPFUL PLEASE SPREAD FOR OTHERS TO USE For any one that has bought this game and has not been able to play it because of the stupid as ♥♥♥♥ connection to games for windows live it still has I figured out what you need to do. You need to right click the game in your steam library and then click on register my game, it will take you to an origin page where you sign in and then you click on redeem code. You enter your product key from steam and it should register your game. Now just restart the game and click enter on your keyboard when the dumb GFWL thing shows up and it should just go away leaving you to play the game you ♥♥♥♥ing paid for, at least in Origin. reviewText:
Bulletstorm is a rare breed of game. It's a fast paced, intensely brutal First Person-Shooter with Arcade mechanics.

This game is a joke on the seriousness of the action genre. It has ludicrous dialogue to go along with it's ridiculous premise. But that's the fun of it. If hilarity isn't your cup of tea, it all comes down to the gun play, and that is where this game shines like a diamond. You have seven main weapons, two sub-weapons that are on you at all times and one weapon you can find and pick up. Each weapon is upgradeable by spending skill points you earn by killing. The more inventive you are with your kills, the more points you will earn. Use the weapons given and the environmental hazards around you to rack up a high score. Easy, Normal, Hard, and Insane difficulties are available.

Weapons:
Bonesduster (Shotgun)
Peacemaker Carbine (Assault Rifle)
Penetrator (Drill Gun)
Flailgun (Chain-Mine Launcher)
Head Hunter (Sniper Rifle)
Bouncer (Grenade Launcher)
Screamer (Pistol)

Sub-Weapon:
Energy Leash
Gravity Boots

Misc. Weapon:
Chaingun (Minigun)


Games similar in gameplay include:
Darkness II
Call of Juarez Gunslinger
Hard Reset
Alien Rage - Unlimited.

reviewText: Bulletstorm was a lot of fun. It's like the video game version of a Jason Statham movie. It's loud, dumb fun with lots of over the top action. There's lots of swearing too. 'Son of a ♥♥♥♥!' The campaign is very linear, but that's ok because there are plenty of fun scripted events. I played all but a tiny portion of the beginning all the way through in one sitting. It took around 7 hours to beat the campaign. There's also a time trial mode where you can play sections of the game over again, trying to rack up points in as short a time as possible. It looks a like Gears of War, but it's an FPS where the main mechanic of the game is killing enemies in different, unique ways. It reminds me of Mad World in that regard. The graphics are fantastic. A good way to tell how much better PCs are than consoles now (and always, amirite!) is by comparing the pre-rendered cut scenes with the real-time ones done by the game engine. It's not even close. I strongly recommend Bulletstorm. It was a blast to play from start to finish!

reviewText: The story line is almost useless but I've had a blast playing this game anyway.  Just pure shooting fun as you run thru different settings with 1 or 2 NPC's.  I'm also playing Borderlands 2 and Tomb Raider but I sometimes take a break and play BulletStorm for a change of pace.  Just finished my 3rd play thru.  Some of the weapons are a blast and for awhile, you remotely control a giant T-Rex like dino and his laser gun eyes.  It is what it is, I like the action and I'm sure after some time I'll go back and play it thru again. Pick it up on sale, it's a helluva lot more fun than a lot of other wannabe shooters.  IMNSHO anyway.

reviewText: Was not expecting the high levels of fun I got out of this, nor the sheer awesome scale of badass muther ♥♥♥♥in' ♥♥♥♥ killin.... Wait, did they just say they were going to kill my ♥♥♥♥? God this game is awesome, ♥♥♥♥ing feels like someone took the old FPS formula and actually did something innovative with it and still have a modern edge. You don't just shoot a guy, you pull him to you with an electric lasso and then charge a bullet the size of a model rocket, shoot it up his ♥♥♥ and watch as he propels into his former buddies and explodes liting them all on fire with what I hope is his ♥♥♥♥ from being so scared as he slowly moved towards me from the lasso. To even talk about some of the levels in this game is to give spoiler to their grand nature of ♥♥♥ kicking. I recommend this if FPS's have felt like crap over the years. reviewText:
get dis game!
pros:
-Well done story
-Unique gameplay (surprising given how many FPS games there are)
-Dialogue is amazing
-Characters are pretty rad
-IMO, it's like Halo + Borderlands +some extra elements thrown in
-Visuals really reflect on the mood of the story
-Wombo Combo game!
cons:
-Games for Windows Live (although it's not very hard to deal with, just a minor annoyance)
-Character's facial expressions sometimes don't show enough emotion to match the voicing
-The occasional forced walking speed got on my nerves, but that's a personal opinion
-Would've liked melees, but again that's a personal opinion
-STORY TOO SHORT PLS GIVE MORE

dis game really good, pls buy is very worth

reviewText:
THIS GAME WORKS FINE!

Dont listen to the people complaing that GFWL aint working for them. Just downloaded and tested it out and my preexisting live account signs in and works perfectly.

With that said Ive been meaning to get this game for years. Such a fun and over the top FPS. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes first person shooters with an arcadey points system built in. It reminds me of a more linear version of Borderlands without the cell shaded graphics and more over the top kills. Buy this game on sale though. Its not worth more than $5 considering its age but its well worth every dollar.

reviewText:
what can i say......i played through this game and had a decent time.  The beginning was weak and the end was weak but the heart of the game shined.  Unfortunately, it was just a gimmick that grew tiring after  a while.  When i think of skill shots i think of the railgun from Quake 2 or 3 and pulling of a massive kill while jumping through the air and turning, only to leave someones giblets flying through the air......not pressing E to kick someone into a venus fly trap hybrid.

I do understand the game isnt suppose to be taken seriously, and the humor is funny but juvenile, but i just cant recommend this game because after 1 playthrough, i couldnt make it through a 2nd.  Not a bad game, but certainly not a great one.

4.5/10

reviewText: WARNING: GFWL.  Buy this game at your own risk.  Seems to work fine for some people, not so much for others(I'm using Windows 7). If you really REALLY want to play it wait til it goes on sale, that way you'd only be out 4 or 5 bucks if Games for Windows Live/Marketplace decides to ♥♥♥♥ you over. If I had a physical copy of this game I'd go outside and set it on fire in an effort to assuage my anger, but I don't so this review will have to suffice.

reviewText:
NOTICE: This game uses Games for Windows Live

What a fantastic shoot-'em-up!

This game's campaign is excellent with fantastic gore and storyline, it will keep you extertained until the very end of the campaign. Once you finish the campaign, there is also a Multiplayer option where players can compete against one and other, but I haven't played Multiplayer yet, so I cannot review it.

The way the game works is by killing multiple enemies and earning Skill Points". These skill points can then be spent on weapons
date: ammo and upgrades for your different weapons. To earn these points you can kill enemies in different ways by looking at the challenges and completing them to earn the points reward. The movement is fluid and fast-paced
recommended: however there is not much liberty in this field. For example
hoursPlayed: there is not a button for jumping and when you wish to jump down from things
voteText: that function is also not there either. The shooting is accurate
helpfulPercent: fast-paced and fun which means that you can shoot with ease. Also
votesHelpful: the aiming down the sights on some weapons is very well detailed and every shot you fire
votesTotal: whilst shooting down your sights
votesFunny:
is guaranteed to hit an enemy.

I was running this game with these specs:
AMD FX-4300 Processor at 3.8GHz
8GB RAM
AMD R7 250 2GB OC Graphics Card

The frame rate was always very stable and I had no issue at all with any frame rate loss.  Any modern computer from mid-2012 to the present day should run this game with no issues
commentsCount: but make sure that you check the minimum system requirement to see whether your computer can run Bulletstorm. The graphics are very nice at High (the highest setting
column16: there is no Ultra setting) and like I said before
column17: hardly any frame rate drops.\n\nWhen running this game for the first time
column18: I had to sign into Games for Windows Live and sometimes when trying to run the game through Steam it would not open. By downloading the current version of Games for Windows Live I managed to get the game working
column19: after that you must sign into a Microsoft account (I used the one that I use for my Xbox Live). Steam will pop up telling you the CD Key
column20: when Games for Windows Live asks for it just put the code that Steam provides you with.\n\nI think this game deserves a 8/10 because it has a brilliant storyline and graphics but in my opinion
column21: Games for Windows Live and the lack of liberty of movement lets the game down a little. However
column22: if you like a game that is fast-paced
column23: fun and has an amazing campaign
column24: then this is the game for you!\n"

It's a quite fun game but at some point I personally found it a bit repetitive.

The main story is pretty good for me, basically you are a space pirate that has been fooled to kill innocent people and you are looking for revenge and want to kill the guy who tricked you.

You end in a planet where everything can kill you and you have to both search a way to go out of that planet and kill that damn guy.

It's pretty well done and fun to play, it took me 7.3 hours to complete the campaing in the maximum difficulty.

I would reccommend this game if you are looking for a linear FPS with a good story.

My rating: 7/10

reviewText: Bulletstorm could have been better. The formula is simple: big guns, lots of enemies, lots of gore, lots of fun ways to toy with your opponents like orcas juggling the half-dead bodies of cute seals. It uses Unreal 3, which is to say it looks like every other game written with Unreal 3: cheap, console-y and graphically dated by about ten years (pixel shaders anyone?) but, like all Unreal 3 games, it will run maxed out at 1080p on anything moderately more powerful than an e-reader, so the framerate is never an issue. There's also only really one boss fight, about half way through, which is a wasted opportunity. But these issues aside, it's mostly carnage and a bit of a laugh, so thumbs up then?\nWell, not exactly. The programmers, as usual, have done their best to scupper the game. The first half an hour is all cut-scenes and quick-time events - totally unplayable. While later cut-scenes are shorter and can be skipped, it frequently does the thing where it makes you walk really slowly to listen to the exposition: bad voice acting, terrible dialogue and a plot I'd really rather wasn't there. When you're not walking with tiny steps it lets you run, really fast, down long, long empty corridors. Shouldn't there be enemies in here? Things to do? Sometimes you run for so long, you carry on running even when you let go of the keys, and this usually happens during time limits - another pointless addition - when having enough control to open a door is somewhat essential. Still, at least the checkpoints are close together. So, still a 6 or 7 out of 10 then?\nAlas not. This game has a villain much worse than any man-eating plant: Microsoft, or more specifically, Games For Windows Live, which is essential for the game to run, even on Steam. Remember when you used to be able to tick the hidden box and create an offline profile? That's gone. It's online only, requires the GFWL client, two software updates, a keycode activation and a sllllloooooooowwwwww login each time. Truly diabolical. All us PC folks are reconciled to Steam now: its lows and its highs, but there is no excuse for this to be bodged on top, and Bulletstorm is impossible to recommend while this unnecessary gimmick is still active. 2/10

reviewText:
Before I get into any proper detail about this game, it should be known from the VERY START that you are not buying something that takes itself seriously.

Cliches are everywhere, the script is tacky, the plot is somewhat predictable and very linear. That doesn't matter at all - you are not buying this for a dramatic story telling experience. What you are in for is an extremely well made shooter that manages to keep itsself fresh while relying on the same mechanics throughout the game.

You can:
- Kick a man into a cactus.
- Manually guide sniper rifle bullets.
- Shoot a man in half.
- Kick hotdog stands at people.
- Tear a pilot from a gunship, then shoot him out of the sky in slow motion.
- Slide towards an enemy at great speed and proceed to send him flying as a result.
- Control a huge mining wheel, broken loose and rolling freely.
- Pick up a minigun and seemingly dissolve enemies.
- Shoot a fat man in his ♥♥♥♥.
- Controll a robotic dinosaur.
This barely scratches the surface of the things you can do.

The game revolves around a mechanic called skillshots - most of the kills you make count towards points you collect - the more extravagant the kill, the more points you earn, and these points go towarsd buying ammo and upgrades for your weapons. Though you can only carry three weapons at a time, the world gives you plenty of oppurtunity to customise your loadout.

The other prime mechanic the game works on doesn't go by name, but is more the staple way of killing people - pulling enemies from afar with a wrist mounted leash, kicking them away, and shooting them in mid air. Most skillshots rely on kicking and/or leashing enemies, and while it sounds repetitive, they keep it fresh throughout the game, by changing enemy types, the environment and your weapons.

In terms of graphics, all of the NPCs are well modelled and animated, along with yourself. The environments, while set in the same planet, are kept fresh and interesting throughout the game, and the level design allows for every playstyle, and caters for every weapon. The graphics, whilst not top notch or very realistic, go along with the style of the game very well, and honestly, you only get a few chances to gawp at the beautiful landscapes before you get back to shooting people in the face.

Whilst there are no negative points, nothing in this game is done to perfection either, but non of that gets in the way at all - you are far too busy having fun, kicking people into cactuses!

Buy this. It redeems your faith in EA a little bit.

reviewText:
This game is actually pretty awesome. You dont buy it for the campaign story. You buy it for the echoes challenges and the wave based survivor mode, have fun performing all the awesome skillshots trying to figure out the best way to combo them together, and get the highest score possible.

I would really love to see a spiritual successor for this game. The skillshot game mechanic is great fun, has a lot of room for improvements and tweaks to make it easier to combo multiple skillshots together for maximum kill enjoyment.

Personally I think the game should have been designed from the ground up as a coop, wave based, survivor shooter. The horde mode thats in the game is great. Player(s) have to meet a minimum score requirement before they can move on to the next wave. That concept just works great with the skillshot system. I really think it could be expanded to have a lot more depth. ♥♥♥♥ aint ever gonna happen though.

Great game with an awesome concept. Sadly it may never be revisited. I doubt the original devs of the game would have improved upon it very much anyway. They most likely would have wasted time and money on more story, which this game doesnt need at all.

reviewText: I mostly thought of this game as a stequence of ridiculous set pieces, strung along by amusingly well-written dialogue. Talking about killing ♥♥♥♥♥ while fighting on top of an exploding dam, or while riding a helicopter around and shooting Godzilla, or walking down the side of a building on magnetic boots, as a set of small examples. It's a very short experience, and definitely very much a corridor shooter. It would be a fairly boring FPS if not for the inclusion of skillshots. The game gives you points for killing enemies in many varied ways, like kicking people into spikes, or bouncing a cannonball around a room multiple times before hitting someone with it. It incentivizes this by making the points into currency, with which you buy weapons and ammo. I would recommend if you want Steve Blum's least insufferable game or just a nice cinematic experience.

reviewText: This game is art if artists used humans to splatter blood all over their canvas or in this case the world. For real though this game is amazing, I honestly forgot how fun it could be. It's like old school meets new school but instead of blending both in for a serious realistic adventure they turned it into a parody of other shooters which is just epic."\n\nThere's plenty of good things say about this game first off the graphics settings are decent not the best but it does the job. Keyboard and mouse works great and is fully rebindable and a controller also works straight out of the box with no problems. There's heaps of hud options to turn off and on like the skill points etc. The gameplay is the best thing about this game it's unique and quite hard to explain but it's just so mindlessly fun! The game has 10 weapons while it is a small number the weapons feel unique and they don't end up bothering you at all. There's a decent story tucked away in the game itself it does it's job it's not the best but neither is it terrible... it's a good laugh at times though. The graphics and art are just beautiful
date: the landscapes are so shocking everything is damn unique in this game you won't go by things and say this is generic. There's plenty of enemy types as well and you won't get to a point and say ♥♥♥♥ please mix it up... for the most part you'll be playing the story but there is also a coop horde mode which mind you no one plays.\n\nThere's not much bad stuff to say about this game but still there are a few to be said like why does the game feel the need to have multiple actions on one key it works well with a controller but it sometimes gets in the way on the keyboard e.g sprint/jump is bound to the same action. The ai while challenging can sometimes feel so cheap they will never... I MEAN NEVER go for your ai teammates they will always run at you or shoot at you
recommended: it can get frustrating. The sprinting it feels good but it makes me feel so damn sick but I suppose that falls under personal preference. The game also doesn't have a fov slider which bugged me quite a bit. There was a huge opportunity missed for a coop story since the ai teammates are damn near stupid to do anything.\n\nI think the game is great it reminds me how much fun a new IP can be... it's a shame we'll never see a sequel but right now as the price stands for $4.99 USD it's totally worth it especially if you're looking for a new and unique experience."

reviewText:
One of the most fun shooters I've ever played. People Can Fly managed to combine everything that defines a great old-style shooter - ludicrous gibs, state-of-art murder weapons with numerous uses and tons of ways to destroy your great numbered enemies. while at the same time getting it right with the modern at the time of release tendencies - cinematographic action and good linear plot.

Energy Leash, Trusty Boot (Duke Nukem style) and Skillshot system are awesome. Game is very rewarding when it comes to the most creative and violent ways that you use to kill the enemies. Shoot him in the balls and kick his head off - done. Put an alien type parasite on his head and electrocute the ♥♥♥♥♥er - done. Put all the enemies high in the air with the help of energy leash and explode them with the chain grenades that you've wrapped one of them in - DONE!

Being extremely fun in terms of gameplay, game developers chose the same way in the script writing. And it pays off 100%. The B-movie like plot of space revenge, giant robodinosaurs and redemption does not give you any chance to stop playing. It keeps you going just to listen to another word exchange  full of black below-the-belt humor between the characters. The main ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ General Sarrano with his black humor bullying and drill-sergeant-like manner of speaking remains one of my favourite B-grade villains in the gaming. It's not that easy to get such a high rank in ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ness.

Soundtrack is made in the same style as Painkiller OST - during the fight you'll mostly hear (aside from the explosions and dismememberment sounds) an adrenaline pumping rock track.

I do recommened this glorious carnage and gibs fest to everyone. Especially to those, who, like me, love the games like Painkiller, Serious Sam, Shadow Warrior and Duke Nukem. Bulletstorm is more linear and story-driven that mentioned games (less freedom of movement, more of freedom in killing to be precise), but just as fun.

People Can Fly, you did it 100% right! I'll be waiting for a sequel.

10/10 (Yes, seriously)

reviewText:
(Note: I originally gave this game a negative review due to the presence of GFWL, Microsoft's decomposing bull phallus of a DRM system, which is well known for making games unplayable. However, I have since located an unofficial patch to remove it from the game, allowing me to finally play it.)

Bulletstorm is a game that lives up to its name. You're a space pirate who crashes on a planet full of psychotic warriors, and you only have one chance to catch a ride out of there before the whole place blows up. Along the way, you will obliterate hundreds of people, fight toxic mutants, and dispense more hot lead than a medium-sized mineral refinery.

It's your standard OTT FPS affair, but with one difference: you get points for how crazy and brutal your kills are. The bloodier and chunkier your combat is, the more points you get. And since upgrades, weapons and ammo are unlocked with points, you're essentially incentivised to be as insanely badass as possible. There are traps and hazards everywhere, and a smart player can use them to wipe out entire squads of enemies in seconds.

I developed my own technique called the 'Emasculator': shoot an enemy in both kneecaps, run up and kick him in the face, hit him with a rifle burst as he flies through the air, yank him back towards you, shoot him in the chest with a shotgun, and then step aside as he falls, screaming, off a cliff.

Overall, a good game with fun execution and a gimmick that leads to some really kickass gameplay.
Final score: 7.5/10.

reviewText:
Only an hour in so far and this game is amazing! Being someone who always looks for combos and certain ways I can merge attacks together this game provides

For example many people use the kick button to knock back enemies then shoot them

What I do however is when an enemy is close to a wall, kick the enemy back on the wall and then keeping press kick as they will bounce of the wall after a couple of kicks they'll die and it will save you ammo

One other cool trick I discovered was that you can use the whip tool to bring an enemy in front of you,  kick him when he gets in front of you, then straight after double tap slide which will make you slide underneath him and shoot  him to your heart's content

This game is also made by the same guys that did Kingdom of amalur I believe and it bloody well shows, this game is truly immersive and isn't your average shoot em up/action type

A defo recommend for me :)

reviewText:
IMPORTANT NOTICE. STOP AND READ BEFORE YOU BUY.

This game uses Games for Windows Live, a terrible DRM that downloads automatically and boots up when you start the game. Games for Windows Live is dying in the near future, meaning this game could become unplayable. It might work fine, but even so, Games for Windows Live is terrible, get the game after it dies if you can.

The only reason I recommend this game is because it IS good, GfWL nearly killed it for me as it took nearly an hour to trudge through all the menus.

As far as the game goes, it's very linear, there are no branching pathes or choices, don't buy this thinking you're getting the next skyrim. Don't get it for the story either, the devs get it out of the way as quickly as possible for the maximum amount of shooting. Story isn't bad, there's just not alot to it. It also ends on a cliffhanger, and there dosen't seem to be a sequel planned.

Get this game for the shooting, because even though it's so linear, it has some of the most fast paced, fun shooting of any fps i've played in a long while.

Get this game to pull a guy 30 yards away from you with your laser whip, only to kick him into a cactus.
Get this game to use your shotgun to kill 10+ dudes with a wave of hellfire.
Get this game to snipe a dude in the balls whilst he's flying through the air.
But most importantly, get this game when it's on sale. Recommended, but not for full price, as it is very short.

reviewText:
One of the most fun shooters I've ever played. People Can Fly managed to combine everything that defines a great old-style shooter - ludicrous gibs, state-of-art murder weapons with numerous uses and tons of ways to destroy your great numbered enemies. while at the same time getting it right with the modern at the time of release tendencies - cinematographic action and good linear plot.

Energy Leash, Trusty Boot (Duke Nukem style) and Skillshot system are awesome. Game is very rewarding when it comes to the most creative and violent ways that you use to kill the enemies. Shoot him in the balls and kick his head off - done. Put an alien type parasite on his head and electrocute the ♥♥♥♥♥er - done. Put all the enemies high in the air with the help of energy leash and explode them with the chain grenades that you've wrapped one of them in - DONE!

Being extremely fun in terms of gameplay, game developers chose the same way in the script writing. And it pays off 100%. The B-movie like plot of space revenge, giant robodinosaurs and redemption does not give you any chance to stop playing. It keeps you going just to listen to another word exchange  full of black below-the-belt humor between the characters. The main ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ General Sarrano with his black humor bullying and drill-sergeant-like manner of speaking remains one of my favourite B-grade villains in the gaming. It's not that easy to get such a high rank in ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ness.

Soundtrack is made in the same style as Painkiller OST - during the fight you'll mostly hear (aside from the explosions and dismememberment sounds) an adrenaline pumping rock track.

I do recommened this glorious carnage and gibs fest to everyone. Especially to those, who, like me, love the games like Painkiller, Serious Sam, Shadow Warrior and Duke Nukem. Bulletstorm is more linear and story-driven that mentioned games (less freedom of movement, more of freedom in killing to be precise), but just as fun.

People Can Fly, you did it 100% right! I'll be waiting for a sequel.

10/10 (Yes, seriously)

reviewText:
Surprisingly, it's a really fun game with a decent to good story. The mechanics and scoring system is awesome and the kills are over the top, in a good way; I mean, there are so many ways to kill people, either from shock pulling them, stomping, kicking, punching, shotting, all sorts of things. And the XP system in this game works in comparison to other titles that try to utilize XP without any RPG elements.

Too bad the sequel was shelved. Only downsides are the cutscenes which have an ungodly low resolution/render output. I don't know why they didn't just use the in-game engine, it's certainly more than capable of outputting at higher resolutions.

8.710

reviewText:
A great mindless shooter for those who like frantic, fast-paced FPSs much like the old Quake and Doom games. The story of Bulletstorm isn't much to write home about, just about a soldier named Grayson Hunt seeking revenge on his employer. Graphics are quite beautiful on maximum settings with great lighting and textures.
For the gameplay, it's like any other FPS game except that you have a whip that you can use to pull enemies closer to you and a button to kick opponents, that sends them flying to the air in slow motion for a stylish kill. The more stylish the kill, the more points you earn to upgrade weapons, buy ammo and unlock additional things.
Sound is superb, capturing the omph" of weapons really well and the voice acting is top-notch (with the main character and supporting characters voiced convincingly).

In conclusion

reviewText:
I won't go into great detail about the general awesomeness that is Bulletstoem itself, except to say that it's the most FUN shooter I've played.  Ever.  Not the hardest or with the most depth (though the game DOES have a suprising level of depth, under all the crass humor) but simply the most flat out FUN.

I mainly just came here to say that, In November of 2014, on Windows 8.1, yes, Bulletstorm DOES work.  Everyone talks about GFWL being dead, yet you can still download the GFWL client from xbox.com, still install it, still login, and it still works just perfectly fine with Steam RIGHT NOW.  The only difference is that now it's called Games for Windows Marketplace" but it's nothing more than rebranded GFWL and it works exactly the same with Bulletstorm.

So it IS up
recommended: and IS an awesome game.  Anyone who says otherwise simply doesn't understand how to install GFWL - which is amazing because it's startlingly simple."

reviewText:
Do you like shooting people in the balls? Do you like kicking people into cacti?
Then you should probably seek some form of help... That's not healthy.
But, if you want to shoot imaginary people in their imaginary balls to tide you over, then this is the game for you!
I highly recommend this to any FPS fans, especially those that want a very silly, point based shooter.
I'm not sure if the Multiplayer still works as I haven't tried it, but there's enough Single-player content here to make it well worth the price of admission!

reviewText: This game is a riot! I've played through the campaign a few times over the course of a few years because it's easy to get into and start messing s**t up! The graphics are good, the gameplay is responsive and fun, you get points for everything you do but the more creative/varied you are when killing enemies the better you are rewarded. There are multiple difficulties to keep your attention and it's challenging enough to stay fun consistently. The NPC commentary while you're playing is funny and entertaining. There are numerous quick-time events throughout the game but they don't detract from the fun too often. I think the cutscenes and especially the player animations are well done. I recommend anyone interested in the FPS genre give this a look.

reviewText:
Surprisingly, it's a really fun game with a decent to good story. The mechanics and scoring system is awesome and the kills are over the top, in a good way; I mean, there are so many ways to kill people, either from shock pulling them, stomping, kicking, punching, shotting, all sorts of things. And the XP system in this game works in comparison to other titles that try to utilize XP without any RPG elements.

Too bad the sequel was shelved. Only downsides are the cutscenes which have an ungodly low resolution/render output. I don't know why they didn't just use the in-game engine, it's certainly more than capable of outputting at higher resolutions.

reviewText:
6/10 - FUN BUT SHALLOW

Firstly i'd just like to say that the BEST THING about this game, and i cannot stress this enough, is the environmental design. It's absolutely breathtaking. There were a lot of moments where i took a few minutes to admire the scenery, it was just that lush. I's go as far to say this is some of the most gorgeous art i've seen in a game, and i feel it was completely wasted on Bulletstorm. I would have loved to see an open world FPS RPG on this planet because i really wanted to explore.

Now it's not a bad game at all, 6/10 is slightly above average and it gets that because of the unique gunplay it offers. The skill-kill" system is a refreshing take on the genre and quite enjoyable. The problem Bulletstorm has is that isn't doesn't go any deeper than that. It's a very shallow game that wears thinner as you encounter the same "challenges" over and over again. I say "challenges" loosley because that's another problem
date: there is no challenge (on normal difficulty). There's also no incentive to try and pull off fancy kills because you easily get skill points (the games currency) through the non-complex kills. The upgrade system is practically non-existant and un-interesting
recommended: so you end up spending your easily earned skill points on buying ammo after you purchase the few upgrades there are. The game is also a very linear shooting gallery
hoursPlayed: with no moving away from the beaten track. This isn't always a bad thing if it's done well
voteText: and i have to say Bulletstorm does it well.\n\nSo it's not all bad
helpfulPercent: even though it's linear and scripted there are a number of cinematic and adrenaline pumping events that do keep you interested and encourage you to press on through the gameplay you've kinda gotten bored of. The combat is great in itself
votesHelpful: especially the sniper rifle. Every shot allows you to control the bulllet as it flies through the air
votesTotal: it's damn cool. I even liked the characters and the story
votesFunny: despite the crude and easy humour i found it hard to dislike them and their cause. I never tried muplitplayer but i've heard it's practically non-existant
commentsCount: so don't expect any bang for your buck there.\n\nI would definitely recommend giving it a play
column16: but for a very low price because it's not a game that leaves much of a lasting impression."

reviewText:
This is another case of a game with a misunderstood mission. It doesn't take itself seriously, at any point, and that's exactly the point - it's a critique on all of the gung-ho, muy-macho, testrosterone-fueled games that are pumped out. It takes the Gears of War trope and relishes in its gorey conclusion.

The nastier enemies die, the more points you get to spend on weapons, ammo, and even more brutal ways to kill your foes.

With excellent controls, a not-too-terrible story, and a distinct lack of humility, this is a game that I may find myself replaying at a later date to relive the glory.

It's glorious, cheesy, over-the-top and an all-around funfest. I highly recommend it.

reviewText: With its incedible vistas and wonderfully varied set pieces, Bulletstorm more than does justice to People Can Fly's legacy. While not all the weapons are equally entertaining, the fantastic combination of the leash and kick, along with the environments you use them in, are the best set of abilities I have experienced since Crysis and BioShock. Even though the campaign is not super long (just under 7 hours for me on the normal difficulty setting), the number of collectibles and the huge library of skillshots make replaying it a very welcome prospect. My score is 9/10.

reviewText: When it comes to first-person shooters, Bulletstorm is a breath of fresh air. From the point system that rewards creative kills to the leash that can pull enemies towards you, the game offers some very interesting and unique gameplay mechanics while maintaining an old-school action-packed feel. The visuals are beautiful and the weapons pack a real punch. The story is pretty forgettable and the ending is somewhat disappointing, but everything else is a blast. Essentially everything that Duke Nukem Forever should have been.

reviewText: A beautiful game that should finally silence the scoffers with all their lies about the same dirty browns and greys of the UE3 generation. Bulletstorm also prominently features a complex scoring system that MUST be mastered to stay alive. It makes each fight fresh and exhilarating, much more than just a raw, physical challenge. Although it was slandered because of this (also in part to its flavorful language), I can't recommend the game highly enough to every genuine lover of the genre.

reviewText:
This game got everything right that RAGE got wrong. The enemies were fun, and easy to kill, and the combat was EXTREMELY enjoyable. Creative ways to kill people made this a unique and exciting shooter.

The story is present, the objectives clear, though most of the feeling is in-the-moment killing enemies and listening to the alcoholic main character come up with childish quips.

This game was not afraid to make fun of itself, and is one of the few games in which the main character is a complete meat-head-drunk idiot, which results in a lot fun. One-liners abound, and the dialogue is dominated by each character trying to come up with the most unique use of profanity. Profanity which is so overwhelming you can't help but to laugh at the stupidty.

This game is two things, stupid, and fun. It knows that, and it doesn't stray from it. Don't expect a deep and moving story, but rather an action-past giggle-fest with poop jokes, guns, swearing, booze, and explosions.

Although it was slandered because of this (also in part to its flavorful language), I can't recommend the game highly enough to every genuine lover of the genre.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game got everything right that RAGE got wrong. The enemies were fun, and easy to kill, and the combat was EXTREMELY enjoyable. Creative ways to kill people made this a unique and exciting shooter.

The story is present, the objectives clear, though most of the feeling is in-the-moment killing enemies and listening to the alcoholic main character come up with childish quips.

This game was not afraid to make fun of itself, and is one of the few games in which the main character is a complete meat-head-drunk idiot, which results in a lot fun. One-liners abound, and the dialogue is dominated by each character trying to come up with the most unique use of profanity. Profanity which is so overwhelming you can't help but to laugh at the stupidty.

This game is two things, stupid, and fun. It knows that, and it doesn't stray from it. Don't expect a deep and moving story, but rather an action-past giggle-fest with poop jokes, guns, swearing, booze, and explosions.

reviewText: Bulletstorm might very well be one of the best games I've played. Developed by Epic Games - the graphics are insanely good and the story is incredibly engaging. reviewText: Take Serious Sam and Duke Nukem, mix it with Gears of War and you'll get Bulletstorm.  Bulletstorm is everything you want in a shooter and more.  Great graphics, amazing set-pieces, and adrenaline fueled action.  Away with the standard aiming for the head like the majority of first-person shooters and bring on the skillshot system which is great for rewarding you with how inventive you can be with slaughtering the oncoming hordes.  Nothing is more satisfying than seeing you setup a kill involving the deaths of 5+ enemies at once and seeing your entire screen explode with points which is used as currency for buying ammo and unlocking weapons and upgrades.

reviewText: This game was a lot of fun. It's a fairly standard FPS, though the main difference is that you are awarded points on how skillfully and how bloody the kills you make are. This adds a lot to the game, and it's fun to see how many different ways I can combine moves to kill enemies. Weapon variation is alright, and you can upgrade them. Level variation is not that great, however. Most of the time you're in a ruined city that looks the same. This happens about halfway through the game, but up until them the game keeps the locations interesting. The only thing holding this game back is GFWL. Seriously, it sucks. Once you get past the GFWL ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, you should be fine. I'd give it a solid 7/10.

reviewText:
Crass, bloody, colorful, and downright hysterical, Bulletstorm is a wonderful romp through a mutated resort planet.

You take the role of Grayson Hunt, a drunk captain of a team of ex-military criminals, on a quest for revenge against the evil general who used you for nefarious deeds. You will slide, kick, shoot, and brutally murder hundreds of men and mutants on your hunt for the general.

The main selling point of the game, the Skillshot system, gives scores and bad jokes as rewards for creative and explosive kills, breathing a much needed fresh air into the FPS genre. Coming in a close second to the combat, the voice acting and writing in the game is top notch, though very crude, and will keep you chuckling as you journey through the 6-8 hour campaign.

BE WARNED, the Games For Windows Live that is a required to launch the game doesn't work, and requires either black magic or a quick .dll hack to get around it.

Well worth the price tag, Bulletstorm is an entertaining time, assuming you aren't easily offended or squeemish.

8.5/10

reviewText:
Surprisingly awesome given how the marketing gives the impression that this is the most obnoxiously generic FPS ever. Gameplay wise, it's an FPS that plays a bit like a cover-shooter. However, while most cover-shooters can get a bit boring in the way they force you to spend most of your game crouching behind objects while your shields recharge, Bulletstorm keeps things interesting with its skillshot system which rewards you experience points to spend on upgrades by killing enemies in the most inventive and over the top ways imaginable.

Likewise, the game also has more wit and charm than its Big dumb dudes with guns" first impression might imply. If this were an action film it would be much more "Bruce Campbell/Sam Raimi" than "Nic Cage/Michael Bay." While some portions of the game are basically "on rails" the action set pieces are so inventive and the level design so well done that you're usually having too much fun to notice. In short: this is what Duke Nukem 4 should have been.
"

reviewText: A genuinely great game. Although you might be expecting something in the 'Serious Sam' vein, this is much more than that. Combat is refreshingly different from your typical CoD clones, and the 'leash' ability is comparable to 'bullet time' in how much it adds to combat. You find yourself looking forward to the next batch of enemies so that you can try new tricks on them. Sure it's violent, but I wouldn't say it's tasteless. The dialogue is funny, the story is pretty good, the setting is engaging and the gameplay is excellently paced. Highly recommended and tragically underappreciated!

reviewText:
Fun, raunchy, crude and just plan silly, everything you would expect from a game named Bulletstorm. I actually really enjoyed this one for it's sheer over the top gameplay.

The game features several unique combat mechanics that really fit well. The guns and upgrade system are top notch, the voice acting is acceptable but far from amazing. The graphics are actually quite nice and the artwork fits the games theme very well. Combat is just a blast, almost non stop and very fast paced. The combat actually reminds me a lot of some of the Unreal Tournament games. I was not expecting much from the story but I was pleasently suprised that it was not terrible, not great but you can only do so much with this type of over the top game.

I would suggest the game if you want to turn off your brain for a few hours and have some insane fun. If you are looking for realism or an atmospheric experience then Bulletstorm is not for you.

reviewText: Bulletstorm is the video game equivalent of John Woo. The dance of a gunfight, combined with clever and opportune use of the environment for really fun combat. Sure it's crass, but in a self-aware way. The designers have implemented a bunch of awesome (if insane) set-pieces. It won't make you cry thoughtfully, but you'll laugh and probably smirk your way through most of the combat. Definitely worth a play.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I had a little trouble getting into Bulletstorm until I learned to let go of years of shooter habits, like using cover and playing the game peering through a red dot sight. This game's unique scoring system is intertwined with game play that is quirky and unconventional; it may look like Gears of War, but it couldn't play its cards any more differently from it.

On the kaleidoscopic alien planet-turned-tropical tourist trap-turned-mutant mosh pit where Bulletstorm takes place, you don't cower behind walls and obsessive-compulsively look down your sights every five seconds; you slide into combat on your backside, kick a baddie head over heels, fire two grenades attached by a chain around his neck (from your two-grenades-attached-by-a-chain gun), electro-whip his friend next to him and push the detonate button for maximum skill points.

The skill points, and the systems built around it, are what make this game so compelling. The combat never gets dull, and never repeats, because the game consistently encourages you to do new things and hands you the tools and environmental dangers to accomplish them. If you're at all jaded by the monotony of modern big-budget shooters, I implore you to give this a try.

The dialogue's pretty funny, too.

reviewText:
*Gnome Seal of Approval*
1st person action shooter with loads of bullets. The action here is unparalleled. You kill enemies by pulling them towards you with a leash or kicking them away from you with your boot. Both ways trigger a short bullet time where you pump their bodies full of lead. Depending on how much style you have in your rampage, you get points for the different combinations. Points are used to upgarde your weapons and buying ammo. Again a great action packed game if you're into the genre.

The negative:
It is clearly ported from the consoles and therefore have some features the PC users don't agree with. An example is the jumping. Instead of jumping over obstacles, you just approach them and ,when prompted, press Space to climb over it.

reviewText:
Fun, raunchy, crude and just plan silly, everything you would expect from a game named Bulletstorm. I actually really enjoyed this one for it's sheer over the top gameplay.

The game features several unique combat mechanics that really fit well. The guns and upgrade system are top notch, the voice acting is acceptable but far from amazing. The graphics are actually quite nice and the artwork fits the games theme very well. Combat is just a blast, almost non stop and very fast paced. The combat actually reminds me a lot of some of the Unreal Tournament games. I was not expecting much from the story but I was pleasently suprised that it was not terrible, not great but you can only do so much with this type of over the top game.

I would suggest the game if you want to turn off your brain for a few hours and have some insane fun. If you are looking for realism or an atmospheric experience then Bulletstorm is not for you.

reviewText: I didn't expect to like this game. I got it more as a curiosity, so I was surprised when I discovered it's one of the most solid, pure shooters to have come out recently. It's linear, but the set-pieces are well-done, the shooting's smooth and the points-for-skill-shots mechanic is well-balanced and pretty fun. The art direction is fantastic - they've created a very colorful sci-fi world. The cussing and humor is pretty sophomoric, but it's so winkingly over-the-top I stopped minding...and some of it's surprisingly funny. I think they may've patched some of the more offensive skill shot titles out, which was probably wise.

reviewText: This game surprised me. Despite its short length and reliance upon tropes, it delivers a very solid and enjoyable FPS experience.  This is the gameplay Duke Nukem Forever should have had.\n\nIt isn't innovative and it isn't deep, but it doesn't try to be more than it is and it has fun while doing it. If you see it on sale, pick it up. You won't be sad.

reviewText:
Son of a ♥♥♥♥, this game is awesome!

Stunts and combat sequences so ridiculously incredible that they wouldn't look out of place in an Ace Rimmer sketch, an expertly composed soundtrack which fits the game like a glove, breathtaking environments and great graphics that make you want to just stop and take them in for a while, characters and dialogue that make you love what you're doing and a plot so outrageous and ball-blastingly awesome it could have been a Stargate season finale; this game has it all.

This isn't your average first person shooter, it rewards you for using your weapons and the environment to make creative kills and combos and it's so satisfying to do so. The Energy Leash is an excellent feature too, it really takes your kills up to the next level.

On top of the fantastic boss battles, you'll find yourself against mini-bosses and a good range of normal enemies too (who will use a nice spread of weapons against you). Speaking of weapons, there are enough to cater to whatever particular bloodlust you're looking to sate, you'll quickly decide on your favourites and be amazed as you unlock something even more destructive.

Aside from the campaign, there are missions called Echoes" which I am yet to try. There's no real multiplayer mode (just horde mode) but there is co-op. You can buy the 2 DLC packs from Games for Windows - LIVE in game (I believe the main feature of these is extra "Echoes")
date: though you do have to use Microsoft Points
recommended: to my knowledge there is no way to just pay for them outright.\n\nWhich brings me onto what is
voteText: the only downside to this game; the fact that it uses Games for Windows - LIVE. GFWL is fine after you get it working
helpfulPercent: you won't even know it's there (aside from the achievements popping on there
votesHelpful: that's why there aren't any on Steam)
votesTotal: but it's getting it working that is the issue. The first time I loaded up this game
votesFunny: my internet was not working properly and I had to play in offline mode - I got 4 hours in and left it at that so I could recover from the heart attack I was getting from the excitement. The next day when I wanted to continue
commentsCount: I discovered that it hadn't saved my game. You must be online for it to save
column16: so it really is an always online game. Luckily the game itself is absolutely brilliant
column17: or I wouldn't have bothered going back through those 4 hours of gameplay to actually finish the campaign.\n\nI could go on
column18: but I want to get back to it.\nIn all
column20: smart
column21:
and absolutley revolutionary for FPS games.
Buy it!

And if any of you shitpiles disagree with anything I have said here

reviewText: This game was much more enjoyable than I had anticipated. The combat was always fun with the miriad of ways to kill a thug. It's short (about 5-8 hours depending on what difficulty you play) and no one plays online anymore, but I did not find myself drudging through it and looked forward to decapitating, nut-crackin, shocking, impaling, slicing, kicking, sliding, burning, splattering, and drowing everything in sight. I've been jaded to first person shooters for a while; however, if you're looking for plain fun and cheesy dialogue; look no further! 8/10!

reviewText: What can I say about Bulletstorm?  You want a story that keeps you engaged til the end?  Don't play it.  But if you want over-the-top shooter gameplay with un-realistic guns and multiple ways to perform kills, then this is for you.  It is more or less about style and scoring points than story.  Oh, and it has ♥♥♥♥ jokes.  Lots of ♥♥♥♥ jokes. (And plenty other toilet humor).

reviewText:
I had to force myself to stop playing so I wouldnt finish it in one day.

1. Visuals are very nice, you will see some cool cenery throughout the game.
2. The combat is really fun, expecially once you get the leash weapon which doesnt take long. When you get it, you are able to use parts of the environment to kill enemies. The weapons are fun to use to, I never get bored with any of them.
3. The Story is pretty simple, however engaging. It's one of revenge but not so cliche as most are.
4. You gain points to use for weapon upgrades and buying ammo. You gain points by killing enemies, but there are quite a variety of ways you can do so. The amount of points you get for each kill is bassed on skill shots"
date:
wich are mini goals during combat. Some are quite challenging to get.
5. The AI of your comrads can be a bit goofy at times. The only thing i'v seen wrong is that sometimes your teammate will stand behind a wall and shoot where the enemies are but just hitting the wall. Thats the only thing i'v seen thats messed up.

This game is really fun. I havent even tried multiplayer yet
recommended: but the main campaign itself is hard for me to put down."

reviewText: The first time I played this game I was thouroughly enjoying it. The game is just so much fun. The combat is fast-paced and exiting and the skillshot system makes you always find new and awesome ways to dispatch your enemies. In addition to the combat I also enjoyed the games dialogue. It was just waay too over the top and crazy, perhaps something you might find from an '80s action flick. I absolutely loved it.\nOne bad thing is however that the game uses Games for Windows Live which is a huge pain. Activating the game can be annoying in the beginning and you need a constant Internet connection to play.\nI recommend this game to anyone who likes FPS games and likes to have fun while playing.

reviewText:
Surprisingly, it's a really fun game with a decent to good story. The mechanics and scoring system is awesome and the kills are over the top, in a good way; I mean, there are so many ways to kill people, either from shock pulling them, stomping, kicking, punching, shotting, all sorts of things. And the XP system in this game works in comparison to other titles that try to utilize XP without any RPG elements.

Too bad the sequel was shelved. Only downsides are the cutscenes which have an ungodly low resolution/render output. I don't know why they didn't just use the in-game engine, it's certainly more than capable of outputting at higher resolutions.

8.710

reviewText:
A great mindless shooter for those who like frantic, fast-paced FPSs much like the old Quake and Doom games. The story of Bulletstorm isn't much to write home about, just about a soldier named Grayson Hunt seeking revenge on his employer. Graphics are quite beautiful on maximum settings with great lighting and textures.
For the gameplay, it's like any other FPS game except that you have a whip that you can use to pull enemies closer to you and a button to kick opponents, that sends them flying to the air in slow motion for a stylish kill. The more stylish the kill, the more points you earn to upgrade weapons, buy ammo and unlock additional things.
Sound is superb, capturing the omph" of weapons really well and the voice acting is top-notch (with the main character and supporting characters voiced convincingly).

In conclusion

reviewText: A first person shooter that emphasis on fast pace action and stylish kills utlizying your environment, your kick and the electro leash. It's a premise that would seem to be well worth a purchase; but the excecution leaves a lot be desired. Poor PC performance, and bad mouse acceleration are the least of this games problems as the campaign makes excessive use of scripted events, QTEs, cutscenes and obnoxious in level prompts.\n\nA great idea destroyed by modern convention. Avoid.
